newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila wins at least $1.2 bln in U.S. investments.
newsitem.headline: Manila wins at least $1.2 bln in U.S. investments.

text.p: U.S. firms have committed to invest at least $1.2 billion in the Philippines, President Fidel Ramos said on Saturday after returning from a visit to north America.

"Of the sixteen projects agreed in California, five are in information technology," Ramos said in a statement. "We estimate that these five projects alone will result in a capital infusion of some $1.2 billion into our country."
Ramos, accompanied by at least 60 local businessmen, made a stop-over in Los Angeles and San Francisco as part of his 10-day visit to Mexico and Panama.

One of the projects include the setting up of a national computer network for Philippine universities, and eventually for companies, between U.S.-software giant Oracle Corp and Philippine Long Distance Telephone Co.
Other agreements involved a mass-housing programme in southern Philippines and a railway network between Manila and the Calabarzon industrial region in Luzon island.
